com.att.research.camusic

Class MusicSqlManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.camusic.MusicSqlManager

  • public class MusicSqlManager
extends Object

    MUSIC SQL Manager

    Program that helps take data written to a SQL database and seamlessly integrate it with a no-SQL store (cassandra)
    Since:
    2014-03-31
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Bharath Balasubramanian

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MusicSqlManager() 
      MusicSqlManager(ArrayList<String> sqlTableNames) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteFromEntityTableInMusic(String tableName, String deletedRowKey)
      This function is called whenever there is a delete to a row on a local sql table, wherein it updates the music/cassandra tables (both dirty bits and actual data) corresponding to the sql write.
      static void main(String[] args) 
      void readDirtyRowsAndUpdateDb(String tableName)
      This function is called whenever there is a select on a local sql table, wherein it first checks the local dirty bits table to see if there are any keys in cassandra whose value has not yet been sent to sql
      void updateDirtyRowAndEntityTableInMusic(String tableName, Object[] changedRow, String changedRowKey)
      This function is called whenever there is an insert or update to a local sql table, wherein it updates the music/cassandra tables (both dirty bits and actual data) corresponding to the sql write.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • updateDirtyRowAndEntityTableInMusic

        public void updateDirtyRowAndEntityTableInMusic(String tableName,
                                                Object[] changedRow,
                                                String changedRowKey)
        This function is called whenever there is an insert or update to a local sql table, wherein it updates the music/cassandra tables (both dirty bits and actual data) corresponding to the sql write. Music propagates it to the other replicas
        Parameters:
        tableName - This is the table that has changed.
        changedRow - This is information about the row that has changed
        changedRowKey - This is the primary key of the changed row

      • deleteFromEntityTableInMusic

        public void deleteFromEntityTableInMusic(String tableName,
                                         String deletedRowKey)
        This function is called whenever there is a delete to a row on a local sql table, wherein it updates the music/cassandra tables (both dirty bits and actual data) corresponding to the sql write. Music propagates it to the other replicas
        Parameters:
        tableName - This is the table that has changed.
        deletedRowKey - This is the primary key of the delete row

      • readDirtyRowsAndUpdateDb

        public void readDirtyRowsAndUpdateDb(String tableName)
        This function is called whenever there is a select on a local sql table, wherein it first checks the local dirty bits table to see if there are any keys in cassandra whose value has not yet been sent to sql
        Parameters:
        tableName - This is the table on which the select is being performed

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception
